text.p: Write a Python function, twoQuadratics, that takes in two sets of coefficients and x-values, sums the results of evaluating two quadratic equations and prints the result. That is, you should evaluate the following equation: [mathjaxinline]a_1*x_1^2 + b_1*x_1 + c_1 + a_2*x_2^2 + b_2*x_2 + c_2[/mathjaxinline]

You should use the evalQuadratic function you defined in the "Quadratic" problem of these exercises (you don't need to redefine evalQuadratic in this box; when you call evalQuadratic, our definition will be used).
This function takes in 8 numbers and does not return anything.
